newsitem.title: USA: CIBER files for 2 mln common share offer.
newsitem.headline: CIBER files for 2 mln common share offer.

text.p: CIBER Inc said Thursday it filed a registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to two million common shares.
Of the total, 700,000 common will be offered by the company and 1.3 million will be sold by selling shareholders, the filing said. After the offering, shares outstanding will total 19,375,016 common.

The bulk of the shares to be sold by the stockholders are held by Bobby G. Stevenson Revocable Trust. Stevenson is also the largest shareholder in the company, chief executive officer and chairman, the filing said.

Underwriter have been granted an over-allotment option to purchase up to 300,000 additional shares. The offering will be made through Merrill Lynch & Co, Hanifen, Immhoff Inc and J.P. Morgan Securities Inc.
The Englewood, Colo., company will use the proceeds to fund expansion including potential acquisition of businesses and general corporate purposes.
CIBER is a provider of information technology consulting including application software staff supplementations and engineering services.
